items.title: Progress indicator: v11 audit
items.body:
## Audit
A designer and developer will pair on this audit, some tasks may be discipline focused. Follow the checklist below for the features and items to review. If there are no issues with the item then check the item as complete. If any problems or bugs come up when auditing add a comment to this issue with the problem and how to correct it (if you know how). Bugs do not need to be fixed while auditing. 

## Resources
- [Design spec in Sketch](https://ibm.box.com/s/v4hk50eol2wkurvtxz295kw6pz094lq5)
- [V11 Website](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/)
- [SCSS](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/tree/next/packages/components/src/components)
- [Storybook](https://carbon-react-next.netlify.app/?path=/story/getting-started-welcome--welcome)


## Checklist

**Visual** (in React code) 
_Design and dev check_
- [ ] Component is using the correct design tokens (color and type), see design spec and scss code.
- [ ] Component is rendering correctly across themes and layers, see design spec and storybook.
    - [ ] White theme
    - [ ] Gray 10 theme
    - [ ] Gray 90 theme
    - [ ] Gray 100 theme
- [ ] Component is rendering correctly across browsers (check themes across browsers as well), see storybook.
    - [ ] Firefox
    - [ ] Safari
    - [ ] Chrome
- [x] Component sizes are rendering and named correctly ([if applicable](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/develop#size-prop-updates-breaking))

 **Website** (v11)
 _Design checks_
- [ ] Style tab has correct design tokens listed 
- [x] Style and usage tabs are using the correct [size props](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/design#sizing) names (if applicable)
- [ ] Usage tab is up-to-date for with any [v11 behavioral](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/develop#changelog) changes (if any)
- [ ] Live Demo has applied v11 changes
   - [ ] Themes are rendering correctly
   - [ ] Size props are named correctly
   - [x] No `light` props included

**Design Kits** (Sketch only)
 _Design checks_
- [ ] Correct design tokens (type and color) are used
- [x] Component using the correct size prop names
- [x] Any additional v11 behaviors have been added

**Storybook**
 _Dev checks_
- [ ] Confirm that prop table is populating 
- [ ] Take note of missing examples/stories (if any)

**React package**
 _Dev checks_
- [ ] Go to https://codesandbox.io/s/github/carbon-design-system/carbon/tree/main/packages/react/examples/codesandbox and confirm that you can use the component as expected from `@carbon/react` 

**Accessibility** 
 _Dev checks_
- [ ] Confirm that there are no violations in Accessibility checker
- [ ] Confirm that component works as expected with VoiceOver

**Migration docs**
_Design and dev check_
- [ ] Any breaking changes to this component are present in the v11 [migration guide](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/overview).
   - [ ] Design
   - [ ] Develop

items.title: [a11y]: Progress Indicator does not support step labels that wrap AND have a secondaryLabel
items.body: ### Package carbon-components, carbon-components-react ### Browser Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge ### Operating System MacOS ### Package version v10.54.0 ### React version v7.54.2 ### Automated testing tool and ruleset Problem found by manual tester ### Assistive technology _No response_ ### Description I asked about the remaining problem (and this one) here... https://ibm-cloudplatform.slack.com/archives/C046Y0YUD/p1647002467687969 I am using a `` . My application supports 10 languages so we have a situation where the labelText for some of the `` components is long. So I was able to easily fix this because the default for the step text (**bx--progress-label**) was `white-space: nowrap;` which I changed to `white-space: normal` But the problem comes in when I have specified secondaryLabelText (**bx--progress-optional**) for a step and the step text wraps or is long and shows an overflow. The problem is that the secondaryLabelText has an absolute position which assumes that the labelText will _always_ be one line of text or never wrapping. With our application, some of the text of the step labels tend to be long and they overflow (which by default shows an ellipsis) due to translation. If I modify the style of the `` labelText so it wraps, then the secondaryLabelText gets overlapped. ### Normal circumstances ### Text too long _by default the step label text does not wrap, overflows with an ellipsis_ ### Change step label text to wrap _if I set the `` labelText to `white-space: normal` the secondaryLabelText is overwritten_ ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25669267/158641546-e0b2c495-45cc-455e-adac-04a53dddbb5c.png) ### WCAG 2.1 Violation _No response_ ### CodeSandbox example https://codesandbox.io/s/compassionate-ellis-bg7fgr ### Steps to reproduce - Create a `` which has several `` components as children with at least one of the steps having secondary label text. - Either create the step label text to be really long or resize/reduce the size of your browser until the step label text extends into the area of the adjacent step label. ### Code of Conduct - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/blob/f555616971a03fd454c0f4daea184adf41fff05b/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) - [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues) for duplicate problems

## Detailed description

Progress Indicator doesn't take up space vertically due to absolute positioning of secondary labels

> Describe in detail the issue you're having.

Progress Indicator doesn't take up space vertically due to absolute positioning of secondary labels so I have to adding custom padding/margins below but the problem is if you have long secondary labels and user window sizes, word wrapping makes the height less predictable.

> Is this issue related to a specific component?

ProgressIndicator

> What did you expect to happen? What happened instead? What would you like to
> see changed?

Positioning is relative so thee full component takes up vertical space.

> What browser are you working in?

Chrome

> What version of the Carbon Design System are you using?

latest
